meanings.definition: To make a theme or topic the central focus or subject.
meanings.sent1: In her story, she will thematise the importance of friendship.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will thematise the lesson around the concept of teamwork.
meanings.sent3: The party planner decided to thematise the event with a tropical theme.
meanings.sent4: The artist will thematise her exhibition around the idea of nature's beauty.
meanings.sent5: He will thematise his speech on the value of perseverance.

meanings.definition: To organize or structure something around a particular theme or topic.
meanings.sent1: The museum curator will thematise the exhibit to showcase different art styles.
meanings.sent2: She likes to thematise her room decorations based on the seasons.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to thematise the menu around a 'farm-to-table' concept.
meanings.sent4: The event planner will thematise the party decorations with a vintage theme.
meanings.sent5: He will thematise the website design to highlight user-friendly features.
